generated_description:
Revoy is an innovative startup aiming to redefine the logistics landscape by hybridizing diesel semi trucks. Founded in 2020, this company emerged from Y Combinator's W22 batch and is headquartered in San Mateo, California. With a lean team of four employees, Revoy leverages cutting-edge technology to convert conventional diesel trucks into hybrid-electric systems in just three minutes—without any upfront costs.

The mission? To make trucking not only more profitable but also more sustainable. By adding electric power to diesel trucks, Revoy promises an increase of $25,000 in annual profits per truck and far superior fuel efficiency—three to five times better, to be precise. The approach minimizes downtime by allowing truck operators to swap out depleted electric units at designated stations, significantly faster than traditional EV charging, which can often lead to costly delays.

What sets Revoy apart is its focus on existing fleets. Companies don't have to invest in brand-new electric trucks, which can be prohibitively expensive. Instead, they can transform their current vehicles into eco-friendlier models with immediate savings on fuel and emissions. In fact, each truck can save an average of over $5,000 annually! 

Whether it’s improving road safety with vehicles that boast a 30% shorter stopping distance or straightforward pricing models, Revoy is facilitating a seamless transition toward electrification in an industry that desperately needs it. So, if you’re in the logistics sector, you might want to consider making the switch to Revoy. Their tagline says it all: "Hook up a Revoy EV — We Charge It, You Drive It." If you're curious, check out their website [here](https://www.revoy.com) for more information.
